TopicTitle: A short movie about Kerbals, Kars, and a tale of utter randomness.

Articles.Content:
Greetings. I the purveyor of random nonsense craft and inane rants of not wanting to go into space, decided to spend a couple weeks collaborating with newer craft designers to create completely mundane everyday vehicles like pickup trucks and KerbalWagens.

I was for some time contemplating on a retro Need for Speed cinematic, and thought that would go very poorly as since when did pickup trucks and KerbalWagens star in high stakes underground hot pursuits? There isn't even a single carbon fiber panel within 20 years of pickup truck or KerbalWagen development.

Everything changed when I posted a couple of 'development screenshot' albums in the two major Facebook KSP groups. One commenter was so audacious as to post a link to a British song, without comment, thinking I would poke at it on my own volition and discover a portal to Narnia or something.

Actually, that's exactly what happened, for in the randomness of a single video comment lay the entire working script of my latest short film, ridiculous to the nth degree yet strangely pleasant in its blatant disregard for KSC traffic laws.

Enjoy
Awww..."You must spread more rep..." Darn song will be stuck in my head now! Sub'd!

Thanks esinohio

Your 'car advertisement' renders for the K-150 Kraptor definitely speeded up development of this short cinematic!

It's probably a quirky non-mainstream subject to cover Kerbal automotive activities but having so many roads in KSC++, and seeing it daily, just makes it so tempting to drive around and explore.
